page.title: 15NEW YORK IN THE PAST
page.content: On New York Road there is a public house(pub)named "Dun Cow Inn" built in 1912.In 1847 there was a Dun Cow Pub standing on the same site as toay. There is a puzzle about New York Board School built 107 years ago,it was named Murton School because Murton was the more important village but the only land available was in New York.There used to be another building where Wheels and Customs is and that was called County Store.This sold furniture.White Washed Cottages were where the newsagents shop now is. The Forge has been standing in its present location for over 150 years, and is still operating.You can still get horses shod there.The house next door was demolished a couple of years ago but in 1881 it was a pub called The Travellers Rest,owned by Anthony Scott Robson.
